post_info.post_title: What is the meaning of life

emoreno2292

But does it have to? It seems to me that humans always have to find some sort of reason for things. And that is understandable, seeing as though in nature, most things have a function and a reason for existing. This by itself is a valid thought, but I believe that the other beliefs that stem from this begin to stretch reason a bit. As for searching for the meaning of life, I salute you. A noble thing to do, but I'm afraid that it will more than likely turn out to be unsuccessful.
Duo_Maxwell
to obtain the closest organism to perfection by a unimaginable years of evolution.
Kronus
Life has no "meaning", any more than a rock or a star has "meaning". We all just "happened", with no purpose, no specific reason. If you want a higher purpose, you'll have to create one for yourself.
Tastyfish

life the condition which distinguishes active animals and plants from inorganic matter, including the capacity for growth, functional activity, and continual change preceding death. 
 
 Easy when you know where to look.

post_info.post_title: What is the meaning of life?

apathy

but seriously,,
 
 this is one of those UNKNOWABLES 
 like "is there a god?"
 or "how did all this get here from nothing?"
 or "will existence ever end?" 
 or "did existence have a beginnig?"
 
 If you really can answer any of these without a great deal of speculation, including "Why?" then you'd be something more than human.

i believe that everything happens for a reasons but i dont know what that reason is.... 
 
 
 Why do you beleive that?
sinjin

Man gives meaning to his life, there is no meaning outside of man's concept.
 The search for meaning might be the meaning but then again that might be a curse.
Phunting

You don't know? Watch the movie:
Exactly it's nothing very special. Try and be nice to people, avoid eating fat, read a good book every now and then, get some walking in, and try and live together in peace and harmony with people of all creeds and nations. 
 
 Either that or 42
Mach

The universe, and all it's confusing majesty, revolves around you, and you alone, while you can live and think. You are the universe (realtively speaking), and thus, you define it's meaning. When your intelligence leaves, so will the universe.
 
 If you're of strong will and with a little fortune and a lot of hard work on your side, you can impose a little of your meaning of life on the universe before you go (hopefully it's a meaning of life that's compatible with the rest of us!!).
 
 "Meaning" is a human-defined word. I'm certain that only you can determine the meaning of "life" (for you). Without any thinking "intelligence" around to think about it, there is no meaning. However knowning "why things happen", is pursued vigorously in the fields of science, often with physics leading the way since physics deals with the interaction of matter/energy, of which we're all made of. It's on their list of things to figure out. 
 
 -mach
Moses

In order for life to be meaningful, for me anyway, it has been that it always includes all these components:
 
 1. Wonder - always learning and never ceasing to be amazed
 2. Truth - being truthful and in search of truth
 3. Love - for significant other, neighbor, God
 4. Security - of the future or afterlife
nerfed

I am a Christian, so I believe that the meaning of life is to be re-acquainted with God and to live your life in according to his Word. Which, in my opinion is a far better life than: "I'm born of chance, I didn't ask to be here, I serve no purpose, so I might as well live egocentrically for the next 78.4 years until my life ends."
CCR1994

I am a Christian, so I believe that the meaning of life is to be re-acquainted with God and to live your life in according to his Word. Which, in my opinion is a far better life than: "I'm born of chance, I didn't ask to be here, I serve no purpose, so I might as well live egocentrically for the next 78.4 years until my life ends."

 
 78.4 years? Well excuse me but I intend to live much longer than that. I was thinking about 112.7 years. Yeah. That's about right.
Stonerpoet

The point of human life is one's own choice. This is why I disagree with the way the world works but let's not get into that. The only real reason we are here is whatever we want it to be. If you're gothic, live, listen to rock, and enjoy yourself. If you're christian, pray, worship and help others, but still enjoy yourself. If you're just a skeeby skateboarder, then by god dude, board, ride, and skate, but enjoy yourself. That is the point; if everyone in the world were happy with the way they were, then this question never would have come up, now would it?emoticon_ic

To RushTFE:
 i believe that everything happens for a reasons but i dont know what that reason is.... emoticon_frazzled
 
 It all depends on what you believe as to our origins as to what you believe the meaning of life is and whether everything happens for a reason. I personally believe that everything happens for a reason. I believe the meaning of life is to love, and to know the Love of God. For it is expressed many times throughout the Bible that God made us out of love - not out of hatred, not because He wanted to be like a nasty kid on the top of an ant hill with a magnifying glass, nor even because He was bored and wanted something to do, he made us out of love so that we could love Him and that He could in turn love us. 
 
 I believe that the reason why we have so many youth susicides in Australia and else where is that they think that they aren't anything special, that they aren't loved and so on, that they are just "rearranged pondscum". But the Bible teaches us that we are special, so special that He sent His Son, Jesus, to die on the cross for us. I've been dealt a few "hard cards" and I'm sure that if I thought that I didn't have a purpose, i.e. just an accident, that I would have killed myself before. Knowing the love of Jesus, however, has stopped me from trying. I am now moving on with my life...
